Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • Job

  • public class Job
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds information for a job process. The class must be instantiated with proper information and cannot be generic. Information that's passed in to the constructor cannot be changed.
    Author:
    Min-Jae Yi

    • Field Summary

      Constructor for the Job class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clockInQueue(int timeIn)
      Clocks in the job to measure time spent waiting.
      void clockOutQueue(int timeOut)
      Clocks out the job to measure time spent waiting.
      void decTimeRemaining()
      Decrements the time the job has left towards finishing.
      int getArrivalTime()
      Returns the time that the job arrives into the system.
      int getCurrentQueue()
      Returns the queue that the job is currently or was in.
      int getPID()
      Gets the job's process ID.
      int getTimeInSystem()
      Returns the amount of time the job spent in the system.
      int getTimeRemaining()
      Returns the amount of time the job has left to process with the CPU.
      int getTimeRequired()
      Returns the amount of time the job requires to finish.
      int getVID()
      Gets the visual ID of the job.
      int getWaitingTime()
      Returns the amount of time the job spent waiting in a queue.
      void incCurrentQueue()
      Increments the current queue of the job to the next level unless the maximum queue level has been reached, to which it will simply stay at that level.
      void setTimeInSystem(int input)
      Sets the amount of time the job spent in the system.
      void setVID(int visualID)
      Sets the visual ID of the job.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Job

        public Job(int pid,
   int arrivalTime,
   int cpuTimeRequired)
        Constructor for the Job class. The class requires the information (not optional).
        Parameters:
        pid - Job process ID
        arrivalTime - Job's arrival time to some time counter
        cpuTimeRequired - Job's time required to completion to some time counter

    • Method Detail

      • setVID

        public void setVID(int visualID)
        Sets the visual ID of the job.
        Parameters:
        visualID - ID of the visual component

      • getVID

        public int getVID()
        Gets the visual ID of the job.
        Returns:
        ID of the visual component

      • getPID

        public int getPID()
        Gets the job's process ID.
        Returns:
        Job's process ID

      • getCurrentQueue

        public int getCurrentQueue()
        Returns the queue that the job is currently or was in.
        Returns:
        Queue of job

      • getArrivalTime

        public int getArrivalTime()
        Returns the time that the job arrives into the system.
        Returns:
        Arrival time

      • getTimeRemaining

        public int getTimeRemaining()
        Returns the amount of time the job has left to process with the CPU.
        Returns:
        CPU processing time left

      • getTimeRequired

        public int getTimeRequired()
        Returns the amount of time the job requires to finish.
        Returns:
        Full time required to finish processing

      • getTimeInSystem

        public int getTimeInSystem()
        Returns the amount of time the job spent in the system.
        Returns:
        Time spent in system

      • getWaitingTime

        public int getWaitingTime()
        Returns the amount of time the job spent waiting in a queue.
        Returns:
        Total queue time

      • setTimeInSystem

        public void setTimeInSystem(int input)
        Sets the amount of time the job spent in the system.
        Parameters:
        input - Time spent in system

      • clockInQueue

        public void clockInQueue(int timeIn)
        Clocks in the job to measure time spent waiting.
        Parameters:
        timeIn - System time when job starts to wait in queue

      • clockOutQueue

        public void clockOutQueue(int timeOut)
        Clocks out the job to measure time spent waiting.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - System time when job finishes waiting in a queue

      • decTimeRemaining

        public void decTimeRemaining()
        Decrements the time the job has left towards finishing.

      • incCurrentQueue

        public void incCurrentQueue()
        Increments the current queue of the job to the next level unless the maximum queue level has been reached, to which it will simply stay at that level.
